text: Saudi Arabia and Egypt want to create a
force made up of several Arab countries
designed to deal with conflicts around
the Middle East an Arab defense force
well they're still trying to figure out
the exact details but it's probably
going to consist of around 40,000 troops
it will have a mixture of aircraft
warships and small elite forces and some
kind of sizeable ground force too though
it's thought that probably won't be used
nearly as much
it'll be Egypt and Saudi Arabia that
stumped up most of the manpower and the
money for this but plenty of other Arab
countries have indicated they're willing
to take part - I think there are several
factors at play here on the one hand the
United States is seen as much less
willing to get involved in the region
and you only have to think about recent
history to understand why then of course
there's the question of how to deal with
Islamic state in its offshoots and for
some countries it's all about finding
ways to confront the growing influence
in the region of Iran there has been a
similar force in existence for some time
made up of some of the Gulf countries
but it's hardly ever being used on the
other hand if you look at Yemen today
you've got the Saudis leading a large
Arab coalition it's a controversial
operation but it has had some success to
the Arabs don't have a lot of recent
experience of working together and they
do still have very competing interests
in the old days it was simple it was all
about Israel now Egypt is very very
preoccupied with dealing with Islamic
extremists in Libya and a Sinai
Peninsula and for the Saudis it's very
very much about confronting Iran so if
this force does actually come into being
the people running it are going to have
to figure out what's this really for
[Music]
